item.title: Starbucks is slashing 30% of its offerings because CEO Brian Niccol says its menu has become ‘overly complex’
item.description: Niccol said the company made progress on its “Back to Starbucks” plan in the first quarter.

item.title: Everything we know so far about the American Airlines jet that crashed into a Black Hawk helicopter
item.description: Rescue craft are in the Potomac River below the site of the collision with D.C. fire chief John Donnelly saying "we don't know" if there are any survi...

item.title: Deutsche Bank reports steep profit drop after splashing $1.7 billion on Postbank legal costs
item.description: Germany's biggest lender was hit by legal costs related to a troubled takeover, resulting in weak earnings.

item.title: Trump wants to use Guantanamo Bay to hold the ‘worst of the worst’ detained in immigrant sweeps—here’s what to know about the Cuba outpost

item.title: Former Sen. Bob Menendez sentenced to 11 years for taking bribes of gold bars and cash and acting as agent for Egypt
item.description: The Democrat resigned last year after becoming one of only a handful of U.S. senators ever convicted while in office.
